description: Borrowed from Italian fondaco (“trading factory, warehouse”), from Arabic فُنْدُق‎ (funduq). Doublet of fonduk.

entries.meaning: (historical, Italian contexts) A type of inn, especially as the residence of a merchant or trader; a trading post, a trading factory.
examples: Genoese and Venetian fondachi (trading depots) littered the coastline from North Africa to the Crimea.
